titleStmt.title: Orders and directions, together with a commission for the better administration of iustice, and more perfect information of His Maiestie how, and by whom the lawes and statutes tending to the reliefe of the poore, the well ordering and training vp of youth in trades, and the reformation of disorders and disordered persons, are executed throughout the kingdome: which His royall Maiestie hath commanded to be published and inquired of, by the body of his Priuie Councell, whom he hath made principall commissioners for this purpose.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
England and Wales. Privy Council.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie: and by the assignes of Iohn Bill,

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: VVestminster the fift day of Ianuary, in the sixt yeere of our reigne.
The first leaf contains large signature-mark "A" in part of a woodcut frame.
The year date is given according to Lady Day dating.
In this edition, D3r line 1 has "Commaund". Most pages are in two or three settings.
Identified as STC 9252 on UMI microfilm.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

person.persName: the Kings most excellent Maiestie: and
